description: From Latin infumatus, past participle of infumare (“to infumate”), from in- (“in”) + fumare (“to smoke”), from fumus (“smoke”).

verbs.description: infumate (third-person singular simple present infumates, present participle infumating, simple past and past participle infumated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To dry by exposing to smoke; to expose to smoke.
